intro: Agalmyla sibuyanensis, commonly known as the Sibuyan agalmyla, is an endemic plant species found exclusively on the island of Sibuyan in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
